did.unittitle: Gerardo M. Gonzalez papers
did.abstract: Dr. Gerardo M. Gonzalez is Dean Emeritus and Professor of Educational Leadership and Policy Studies at the Indiana University School of Education. In 1962, when Gonzalez was eleven years old, he and his family immigrated to the United States as refugees from Cuba. The first in his family to graduate from college, Gonzalez has since become a prominent academic leader in the United States and a proponent for higher education leadership, healthy campus environments, and Latino educational concerns. The papers and photos in this collection relate to Gonzalez's upbringing and his family's emigration from Cuba to the United States in the early 1960s, as well as Gonzalez' education and academic appointments. Many of the materials in this collection are reproduced or referenced in Gonzalez's 2018 memoir A Cuban Refugee's Journey to the American Dream: The Power of Education .

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Collection is open for research. Advance notice required.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Dr. Gerardo M. Gonzalez is Dean Emeritus and Professor of Educational Leadership and Policy Studies at the Indiana University School of Education.

Gonzalez was born on September 24, 1950 in Placetas, Cuba. Gonzalez, his parents, and his sister Maritza immigrated to the United States as refugees from Cuba in February 1962, three years into Fidel Castro's rule, when Gonzalez was eleven years old. The first in his family to graduate from college, he went on to become a prominent academic leader in the United States.

After starting out at Miami Dade Junior College, Gonzalez received his B.A. degree in psychology in 1973 and his Ph.D. in counseling and higher education administration in 1978, both from the University of Florida. He came to Indiana University after serving as the interim dean of the College of Education at the University of Florida in Gainesville, where he was also a professor and chair of the Department of Counselor Education and the associate dean for Administration and Finance.

Gonzalez served as dean of the IU School of Education from 2000-2015, directing administrative and budgetary activities and providing academic oversight to education programs on six regional campuses of Indiana University. Upon his retirement from the deanship in 2015, Indiana University President Michael McRobbie presented Gonzalez with the President's Medal for Excellence.

A recognized expert on drug and alcohol education, in 1977 Gonzalez founded Boost Alcohol Consciousness Concerning the Health of University Students (BACCHUS), the nation's largest peer-based collegiate organization for the prevention of alcohol abuse.

Gonzalez is also active in multicultural counseling and education issues, and has published scholarly works on the Cuban-American experience and Latino educational concerns. His memoir A Cuban Refugee's Journey to the American Dream: The Power of Education was published by IU Press in August 2018.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Collection is organized in roughly chronological order.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of family papers and photos related to Gerardo M. Gonzalez's upbringing and the emigration of Gonzalez and his family from Cuba to the United States in the early 1960s. It also includes documents and correspondence related to Gonzalez' education at Miami Dade Junior College, the University of Florida, and his academic appointments at UF and Indiana University. The materials in this collection date from 1952 to 2018, with the bulk dating from 1961 to 1963, around the time of the family's emigration. Types of material present in the collection include photographs, school records, correspondence, boarding passes and flight tickets, and newspaper clippings.

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Material
separatedmaterial.p: 16 photos were removed and are housed with the Archives Photograph Collection. These include Gonzalez's 1956 passport photo; family photos of a young Gonzalez and his immediate and extended family in the 1950s and 1960s; and his ID card from Miami Dade Junior College. The photos in this collection appear in or are referenced in Gonzalez's 2018 memoir, "A Cuban Refugee's Journey to the American Dream: The Power of Education." For more information, please contact the University Archives staff.

custodhist.p: Files were gathered by Gerardo Gonzalez in the process of writing his memoir A Cuban Refugee's Journey to the American Dream: The Power of Education.
Transferred by Gerardo Gonzalez to the University Archives in August 2018.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The files in this collection remain in the order in which they were originally received, with the exception of moving the folder "Ivy Tech Bloomington Commencement Address, 2012" to the end of the box to preserve chronological order.
